I checked out of AmazaInn the next morning and moved to another hotel for the rest of that week. I contacted the travel agency that I used and told them my experience. They called the hotel that night and spoke to another desk clerk that informed us that they knew the internet wasn't working for a few days and she said that the other desk clerk should have told me that instead of insisting my laptop was the problem. The next morning the travel agency called the manager and he refused to compensate us in any way. These people are dishonest and rude. My advise is to stay away from this hotel. The air conditioner thermostat was also set too high. I had it set to Maximum cool and our room was still around 80 degrees all night. Our room would not get cool enough but the thermostat kept turning the air conditioner off and on all during the night. It was 100 degrees everday we were in town and that night,,,,we were very hot. Thank God for the other hotel. Their rooms are very cool and they offer free wireless internet.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: RanaeB
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights and couldn't of asked for anything better for the price. We had a room with 3 queens...AWESOME!!! There was a breakfast every morning...My Daughter had oatmeal 1 morning so I can't say much about breakfast. Roomy rooms, and very quiet when we were there. Location was good for us, not on 76 HWY with all the hustle and bustle. No problems!! Will stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Clean Hotel w/ outstanding customer service.”
Reviews.Author: 4Faulks
Reviews.Content: I called the morning I planned on arriving. My 7 year old had decided to go to Branson, stay in a hotel, swim and play mini golf in lieu of a big birthday party. I debated on staying at one of the standby chain hotels, but the reviews for the AmazInn changed my mind. The front desk clerk was very helpful and really took her time in explaining the different room options and cost. Check in is normally at 3:00 p.m. However, we were allowed to check in at approximately 1:30 p.m. I appreciated this since we were already in town and my son was antsy wanting to swim. I had reserved a king suite, which is a king bed, pull out sofa, microwave, refrigerator, jetted tub (standard bathtub w/jets), table with two chairs and coffee pot. The room was large and very clean. There were plenty of towels in our room as well as a bar of hand soap. There is a dispenser in the shower for soap. I only mention this because a previous reviewing commented that there was no shampoo or conditioner in the room. The pool is located outside and there's a spa in the pool area. There was plenty of pool side seating and plenty of pool towels. The pool area was never crowded at all. Continental breakfast was good. There were biscuits, gravy, bread, bagels, cream cheese, peanut butter, jelly, hard boiled eggs, donuts, juices, instant oatmeal packages, cold cereal, milk and fruit salad. The breakfast area was very clean and well kept. The breakfast attendant was very nice and sociable and kept the buffet full. The hotel is located on the Shepard of the Hills Expressway which means that if you use the short cuts, you will not have to sit in the traffic on Hwy 76. This was a huge plus for us since we didn't plan on seeing any of the shows and wasn't interested in seeing the tourist destinations/traps along Hwy 76. There were a couple of mini golf courses near the hotel. We paid a total of $80.04 for our room on a Saturday night, in the peak travel season. This room is comparable to the Holiday Inn Express and Comfort Inn & Suites I've stayed in before.

Reviews.Title: “Good southern breakfast, but no shampoo/conditioner”
Reviews.Author: Sam_Usa
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night over this Memorial Day weekend at AmazzInn & Suites motel. We paid about $60+tax for a value room with 2 queen pillowtop mattresses, in-room coffee maker, alarm clock, TV, and hairdryer. Room was big and clean, but had a musty smell. No microwave/fridge for our value room. No mini shampoo & conditioner, but they do have a bath soap dispenser over the bathtub. Motel seem to have been recently refurbished. Staff were friendly & helpful when we asked for directions. Continental breakfast was adequate - warm biscuits & gravy, donuts, hard-boiled eggs, cereal, milk, coffee, and juice. Breakfast area could be cleaner. They do provide free Wi-Fi. Location was great, along Shepherd of the Hills Expressway on the red route, next to Orange Blossom motel, and across from IMAX theater. Our motel and surrounding areas were quiet but very well lit all night. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: puddin68
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here just one night, but would stay longer if needed. The room was clean the staff was very friendly and the breakfast was a nice surprise. I booked my room with Sea Breeze Vacations travel agency .We got a great deal. $43.75 so you see I was a little worried. This is not a luxury hotel, it is a nice, clean, friendly place to stay. The name says it all, it was Amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: MissouriW
Reviews.Content: We stayed in two rooms on the night of May 9, 2009 and were extremely pleased with the cleanliness and condition of the rooms. All the personnel we dealt with were very friendly and the breakfast was good. New beds were extremely comfortable. We will definately recommend this facility to others and stay there on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here- don't look anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: blcap
Reviews.Content: Great, convenient, safe location. Close to everything. Flattest spot in Branson. Great parking, first floor room was four steps from car trunk to room door. Hotel has been refurbished, new beds, large clean rooms, friendly staff. Reserved online and got a great discount. Breakfast good also.We will stay here next time. Oh, don't forget to get an after show ice cream at the ice cream shop (Dremi Creams) right in the parking lot!

Reviews.Title: “Odor was terrible”
Reviews.Author: spruce52
Reviews.Content: The hotel looked clean, lady at the desk was nice, but when we got to our rooms, the odor was nauseating. Both rooms had a strong odor like body odor. Another person staying there said their room smelled also, but they were going to try to stay. We opened the doors for a bit, hoping the fresh air would take away the smell, but it didn't improve. My mother, 2 sisters, grandson and 2 nephews and I agreed that even though we would lose the money we paid for two rooms, we couldn't bear to stay there. We checked out after 1/2 hour and went to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was very Prompt”
Reviews.Author: kadmonkey75
Reviews.Content: II was expecting a lot less when I arrived we stayed for 4 days and had no major issues the room was clean the shower the bathroom was clean looked like nice heavy duty carpet the pool was nice (older pool but kept clean could use a better paint job around edge to make it look nicer) and the hot tub was working but Staff was needed to be called to clean it from the previous night @ 10:am when the pool opened up no biggy was cleaned within 5 mins. we had some unruley kids in the pool and the staff jumped on the problem and took care of it the room was a double queen it was clean and basic but the staff was helpful and kind we traveled with two small yorkies and had no problems they are a pet friendly hotel which is nice to have the beds where not that great (but I wasn't expecting the world's greatest mattress) but all in for the price I got I can not complain it is off the main strip on sheperd of the hills expressway so isnt to bad to get out and about the pool and hot tub stay open late so that you can enjoy it after a show or round of mini golf they have 2 floors per building with good access with stairs. I will go back and stay there the staff was kind helpful the front desk fixed any problem quickly and the only problem I had was the unruly Teenagers in the pool and the hot tub not being cleaned yet before the pool opened but I am sure that was just because I arrived there @ 10:am the cleaning staff made sure we had plenty of towels and TP paper

Reviews.Title: “Very nice "no frills" place with a nice, clean pool”
Reviews.Author: 63vettegal
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice, inexpensive place to stay while seeing the sights of Branson. Centrally located and close to music, shows and great restaurants, this place was very clean and tidy and had a GREAT, clean pool. rooms were above average CLEAN and very nice for the $50 per night we paid. We will definitely stay there again. And the hot tub WAS working when we were there and very enjoyable after the sun went down! The pool was fantastic and very cool during the day and my son enjoyed it immensely. i highly recommend this as a no frills place to stay.

HotelInfo.Name: AmazInn & Suites
HotelInfo.Address: 3311 Shepherd of the Hills Expressway, Branson, MO 65616
